alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 5:08PM CDT until September 04 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, especially over areas west of Cleo. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, South Llano River State Park, Roosevelt, Cleo and I-10 Near The Sutton-kKmble County Line. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 461. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, County Road 275 crossing North Llano River, Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River, KC 210 crossing West Bear Creek, crossings along County Road 410 and County Road 260 crossing North Llano River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
